intro: Choretrum pendulum, commonly known as the hanging choretrum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often blooming in the summer months. The leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
